description: An SNMP trap definition for carrying Xedia system
events. Some events have specific SNMP traps, such as linkUp
or linkDown traps. (These are generally events with levels of
info(3), warning(4), or fatal(5).) The events which do not
have specific SNMP traps defined for them will be sent using
this NOTIFICATION-TYPE if xsysEventsAsTraps is set to
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysSystemEvent XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventDateTime s EXAMPLE XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventSubsystem s EXAM-1 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventLevel i 5 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventId u 0 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventMsg s EXAMPLE

$SNMPTRAPCMD XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysSystemEvent XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventDateTime s EXAMPLE XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventSubsystem s EXAM-2 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventLevel i 4 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventId u 0 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventMsg s EXAMPLE

$SNMPTRAPCMD XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysSystemEvent XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventDateTime s EXAMPLE XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventSubsystem s EXAM-3 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventLevel i 3 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventId u 0 XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventMsg s EXAMPLE

description: The date and time when this event was generated.
variables.name: XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventDateTime

description: The subsystem this event was generated by.
variables.name: XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventSubsystem

description: The identifier of the event. This id is unique within a
variables.name: XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventId

description: Textual message associated with the event.
variables.name: XEDIA-SYSTEM-MIB::xsysEventMsg
